content:
It had been such a peaceful village. Had.

Last night, a
wonderful event
terrible tragedy had occured.


Fate, Town Mason, has been slapped in the face with a fish on Night Zero, then shot.




After some investigation, you conclude as a town that, unbelievably enough, the attack on Fate wasn't personal at all.
There are those among you who wish to slap each of you in the face with a fish, then shoot you.

Stop them.





Rules
(stolen from Faraday who stole them from Hoopla with some modifications).


> Fundamental

1) The site-wide rules apply, please read them and don't do anything stupid.
2) Unless it is explicitly stated in your role PM that you can do so, do not talk about this game outside of the game thread.
3) Do not quote any communication you have with me, the moderator of the game. Depending on the circumstance, you may be able to paraphrase things I have sent you (such as a role PM). Use common sense and if you are unsure feel free to ask me via PM. This includes timestamps of role pm's. You may share the quotation in your role pm, if there is one, however. This doesn't have to be paraphrased.
4) Be courteous to your fellow player. This is just a game - please don't bring personal grudges into the game. Try and keep it civil.
4a) No Sig/Avatar bets, I can't have someone having an awful avatar as a result of my game.

> Voting, Lynching & Death

5) For your vote to be counted, it must be bold, and in the form
Vote: Hoopla
. Caps and colons are optional, but it does need to be bolded.
6) Unvotes aren't necessary, but will be appreciated.
7) A lynch will occur when a player achieves 50% rounded up of the votes. When this has happened, any subsequent votes and unvotes will not be counted, and the game will enter twilight. Night will begin as soon as I have declared the lynch.
8) You may vote for a ‘no lynch’ if desired. If at least 50% of the players in the game vote for a no lynch, the game will progress to night without a lynch.
9) Once you're dead, you are dead. You are allowed one contentless "bah" post which may only contain the letters "F" and "U". You may use as many of each letter as you want.


> Activity & Deadlines

10) Treat this game as a commitment, and try your best to stay active.
11) Prods will be issued after 48 hours in a row without posting. If I keep having to prod you I'll get angry and replace you. Players may request a prod on another player too, I'm human I may forget so if you want someone prodded just tell me.
11a) If you do not open a prod within 24 hours of it being sent I will begin looking for a replacement.
12) Things come up in life, if you need time off for something, please let myself and the players know in-thread for V/LA purposes. I will be flexible, but if you can't be here for a significant amount of time I will replace you.
13) Deadlines for each game day will be 17 days unless specified as otherwise

14) In the event of a deadline ending without a player gaining a majority of votes, there will no lynch.
15) Nights will have a 72 hour deadline. If you fail to send in a night choice, I will automatically default to 'no choice' for that night, and you will do nothing.
16) Deadlines will only be extended if I need a number of replacements, or barring some other freak circumstances. Apart from that laziness, or anything else, will not result in a deadline extension.


> Other Information

pre-17) No mechanism or website may be used to prove that a decision was achieved randomly. I.e. you may chose who claims first by rolling a dice, but you'll have to trust the person who rolled the dice not to lie.
17)
RED
and
GREEN
font are my colours I will use for modly purposes. All other colors are fair game as long as they are easily read by your other players/myself. I'll not modkill you if you happen to use them, but try not to please.
18) I will try to post Vote Counts as often as possible. If you feel a vote count is needed, don’t hesitate to ask for one, and I’ll provide one at the next opportunity.
19) It's more than possible I've missed a rule or haven't completely covered something. Don't be a prick and try to exploit it, or I will punish you. If something is fuzzy for you, please ask!
20) I reserve the right to add more, or modify existing rules at any time. If this happens, I will let everyone know in thread.
21) The penalty for faking violation of a rule will be the same as actually violating the rule.
22) Have fun!
23) No slapping the moderator with fish.
Sample Vanilla townie role pm:
chesskid3 wrote:Welcome to "don't get slapped in the face by a fish" Mafia, XXX. You are a
Vanilla Townie
.

You have no abilities other than your voice and your vote.

You win when all the threats to the town have been eliminated. Please confirm your role by PM.

The game can be found here: http://mafiascum.net/forum/viewtopic.php?f=2&t=16959

Good Luck!

Done catching up, so here's some initial thoughts:

-Without a flip, I don't think a lot can be inferred about Shift's alignment simply from his uneasiness over an early L-2 wagon. Townies can be cautious about early wagons, scum can pretend to be cautious about early wagons. Not seeing the scumminess there--it's more likely a null tell. Also, Shift, why do you think it should be automatic to claim at L-1? I mean, aside from being used to that format--do you have reasons for thinking that?

-Otolia's offer to claim is really anti-town; I'm partly inclined to give him a pass on communication differences, but, still, really not good. I do want to know, Otolia, why are you proclaiming that you will probably unvote before you have done so?

-Gorilla, you state you're reluctant to vote Shift to L-1, but you don't say directly whether you find him suspicious. Do you? If not, who do you suspect at the moment?

-Coyote, on a similar note, is your vote of Shift in #44 random or not? I can't tell looking at it.

-Gandalf's recent unvote raised my eyebrows. His vote on CoolDog was doing no harm where it was at--indeed, I think it was the only one--so why the seemingly urgent necessity to unvote? If CoolDog had been wagoned, I might understand, but unvoting without revoting in this sort of circumstance looks much more suspicious.

Once upon a midnight dreary, while I pondered weak and weary,
Over many a quaint and curious volume of forgotten lore,
While I nodded, nearly napping, suddenly there came a tapping,
As of some one gently rapping, rapping at my chamber door.
`'Tis some visitor,' I muttered, `tapping at my chamber door -
Only this, and nothing more.'

Ah, distinctly I remember it was in the bleak December,
And each separate dying ember wrought its ghost upon the floor.
Eagerly I wished the morrow; - vainly I had sought to borrow
From my books surcease of sorrow - sorrow for the lost Lenore -
For the rare and radiant maiden whom the angels named Lenore -
Nameless here for evermore.

Some late visitor entreating entrance at my chamber door; -
This it is, and nothing more,'

Presently my soul grew stronger; hesitating then no longer,
`Sir,' said I, `or Madam, truly your forgiveness I implore;
But the fact is I was napping, and so gently you came rapping,
And so faintly you came tapping, tapping at my chamber door,
That I scarce was sure I heard you' - here I opened wide the door; -
Darkness there, and nothing more.
